column4: hi please, i need to know how to look built modules in my kernel. I have to do this:   Validate you don't have loaded (or built into the kernel) the Linux community provided  driver for Broadcom hardware
if you run: lsmod you can see all loaded modules
you can freely pick her brain
why are you concerned about what is usualy
the "usual" anything will change as the users do in the channel
if they are in the repo they are all equally support
if you asked in 2 days, you might get a different answer so "most used" is moot and doesnt exist
each app has a man pae made by the devs
there will be guides for any app you can use
man cp is clear as day
if you run: route    it will output the default route which will bne the ip, 192.168.0.1 is a good first try thouggh as most home grade routers use that address
